title: Verify: Selecting the GoPro Next Channel successfully opens GoPro Next
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Playstation device
AND has added the "GoPro Next" Channel
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the "GoPro Next" Channel from the Playstation menu
custom_expected: THEN the "GoPro Next" app will open successfully

title: Verify: User not logged in, receives access gate.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Playstation device
AND has added the "GoPro Next" Channel
AND user has never logged into app
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the "GoPro Next" Channel from the Playstation menu
custom_expected:
THEN the "GoPro Next" app will open successfully
AND the splash screen with Go Pro Next logo displays (against black background)
AND is followed by a short video clip (wave: in tube perspective) during loading
AND when video completes playback displays a still image of a wave that blurs 
AND becomes the background image for the access gate where user can login.

![](index.php?/attachments/get/4539)

title: Verify: User logged in, receives no access gate.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Playstation device
AND has added the "GoPro Next" Channel
AND user has previously logged into app
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the "GoPro Next" Channel from the Playstation menu
custom_expected:
THEN the "GoPro Next" app will open successfully
AND user does not receive an access gate
AND user is taken to the Discover screen

title: Verify: Video Background - Welcome Screen - Surf Intro
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Playstation device
AND has added the "GoPro Next" Channel
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the "GoPro Next" Channel from the Playstation menu
custom_expected: THEN there will be a video playing in the background to add motion/depth to the screen which will give me a preview of the type of content I may see by signing in to GoPro NEXT

title: Verify: GoPro Logo displays while the app loads
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Playstation device
AND has added the "GoPro Next" Channel
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the "GoPro Next" Channel from the Playstation menu
custom_expected: THEN the GoPro Logo will displays on the screen when app is launching

title: Log In: Selecting Log In takes user to login in screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Playstation device
AND has added the "GoPro Next" Channel
AND user has not previously logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the "GoPro Next" Channel from the Playstation menu
AND user selects "LOG IN" on the access gate screen.
custom_expected:
THEN user is taken to the login in screen
![](index.php?/attachments/get/4540)

title: Log In: Verify Login success
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Playstation device
AND has added the "GoPro Next" Channel
AND user has not previously logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the "GoPro Next" Channel from the Playstation menu
AND user selects "LOG IN" on the access gate screen
AND user enters in a valid email and password then selects Log In
custom_expected: THEN user successfully logs in and is taken the Discovery screen

title: Log In: Verify Login failed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Playstation device
AND has added the "GoPro Next" Channel
AND user has not previously logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the "GoPro Next" Channel from the Playstation menu
AND user selects "LOG IN" on the access gate screen
AND user enters in a bogus email and bogus password then selects Log In

Alternatively, try entering a valid email and a bogus password.
custom_expected:
THEN user receives an error message "Email or Password unrecognized!"

![](index.php?/attachments/get/4541)

title: Log In: Pressing the Back button from the Login Screen returns the user to the previous screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Playstation device
AND user has not previously logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the "GoPro Next" Channel from the Playstation menu
AND user selects "LOG IN" on the access gate screen
AND user presses the circle button (O)
custom_expected:
THEN we will be returned to the previous screen

![](index.php?/attachments/get/4542)

title: Log In: Verify after incorrectly entering credentials the user is able to enter credentials again
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Playstation device
AND has added the "GoPro Next" Channel
AND user has not previously logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the "GoPro Next" Channel from the Playstation menu
AND user selects "LOG IN" on the access gate screen
AND user enters in a bogus email and bogus password then selects Log In

AND user receives an error message "Email or Password unrecognized!"
AND user renters enters in a valid email and valid password then selects Log In
custom_expected: THEN user is able to enter valid credentials and login after a failed login attempt.

title: Log In: Forgot Password
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Playstation device
AND has added the "GoPro Next" Channel
AND user has not previously logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the "GoPro Next" Channel from the Playstation menu
AND user selects "LOG IN" on the access gate screen
AND user selects "Forgot Password?"
AND user enters their valid email 
AND user selects "RESET PASSWORD"

AND user checks their email (of that same address)
custom_expected: THEN user receives a password reset email

title: Log In: Forgot Password - invalid entry
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Playstation device
AND has added the "GoPro Next" Channel
AND user has not previously logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the "GoPro Next" Channel from the Playstation menu
AND user selects "LOG IN" on the access gate screen
AND user selects "Forgot Password?"
AND user enters invalid entry (missing @ symbol)
AND user selects "RESET PASSWORD"
custom_expected:
THEN user receives a error message:
Must Enter Valid Email Address
AND user is able to re-attempt entering email address.

![](index.php?/attachments/get/4543)

title: Verify Discover contents
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user navigates to the Discover page via the header

(OR has previously logged into the app 
AND has just launched the app)
custom_steps: WHEN the page loads
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be presented with a horizontal scrolling, curated list of content 
AND it will include any of the following:
Upcoming (or past) Live event(s) 
Individual video clips
Episode
Show (playlist)
Channel (playlist(s))
Playlist 

ex of full ribbon: (only a portion of the list is viable at any given time)
![](index.php?/attachments/get/4549)
ex live and playlist (large tiles):
![](index.php?/attachments/get/5424)

note: in future release this curated list may be filtered via user's initial choices during

title: Tile not in focus - Static image
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the Discover page
custom_steps: WHEN user observes tiles for an individual video that are NOT in focus
custom_expected:
THEN the static image representative of the video content displays
AND the metadata (title and *headline (not description)) appears in an accompanying text box
+large video tile: text box appears below image
+small video tile: text box appears to the right of image

*headline may be called editorailTagline in the JSON

![](index.php?/attachments/get/4554)

title: Tile in focus - In-Line player
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the Discover page
custom_steps:
WHEN user an individual video into focus 
(blue highlight surrounds the tile and enlarges slightly)
custom_expected:
THEN the static image will be replaced by a loading animation (for a few seconds as video loads)
AND the video will begin to playback "in-line" (in the tile where static image used to be
AND the metadata will continue to display in the text box

title: Verify In-line player to full screen playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the Discover page
AND an individual video tile has been brought into focus
AND the video is playing in-line
custom_steps: WHEN the in-line video tile is selected: via (x) button press
custom_expected: THEN the in-line video will expand to playback full screen

title: Verify backing out of full screen (in-line player) playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the Discover page
AND an individual video tile has been launched to fullscreen playback
AND video is actively playing
custom_steps: WHEN the user closes full screen view: via (o) button press
custom_expected:
THEN the full screen playback will minimize back into the in-line video tile
AND will continue to playback without issue until it reaches completion (or User interaction)
AND at completion the image will revert to the static image

title: Verify in-line player toggle to full screen and back doesn't effect playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the Discover page
AND an individual video tile has been launched to fullscreen playback
AND video is actively playing
custom_steps: WHEN the user presses (x) select and (o) close to toggle between full screen and in-line video playback
custom_expected:
THEN the full screen playback will minimize back into the in-line video tile
AND will continue to playback without issue
AND will again launch to full screen playback without issue

title: Verify In-line player to full screen playback - Up Next view
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the Discover page
AND an individual video tile has been selected and launched to full screen playback
AND the video is not the last tile on Discover page (i.e. last in playlist)
custom_steps: WHEN d-pad down is pressed
custom_expected:
THEN the Up Next video player overlay will display
AND the currently playing video will be correctly identified (by scrim with Now Playing text)
AND the next video in the list (to the right) will be in focus by default
AND (if applicable) the subsequent videos will be listed in order
AND they are each able to be brought into focus and/or selected

title: Verify Up Next view successfully launches video
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the Discover page
AND an individual video tile has been selected and launched to full screen playback
AND the video is not the last tile on Discover page (i.e. last in playlist)
AND the Up Next video player overlay is displayed
custom_steps:
WHEN the user brings focus to a video in the Up Next playlist
AND a video tile is selected
custom_expected:
THEN the currently playing video will stop playback
AND a loading animation will display briefly
AND the selected video (from the Up next Playlist) will start playback full screen
AND the user will be able to view/interact with the media transport controls, and video overlay drawers (extras, up next, details) without issue.

title: Verify Channel tiles
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user navigates to the Channel page via the header
custom_steps:
WHEN the page loads
AND the user navigates down from the Channel Header
AND navigates right, left, up and down
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be presented with a horizontal scrolling list of Channel tiles
AND each of the tiles will be able to be brought into focus 
AND when a tile is selected will take user to the appropriate channel page

Examples:
Next (large tile - curated to promote top GoPro content)
--the rest are small tiles--
Outdoor small
Team
Music
Action
Lifestyle
Motor
GoPro Awards

![](index.php?/attachments/get/5281)

title: Verify channels open to Channel page
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is on Channels global navigate page
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects a Channel tile
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the Channel page
AND the background will display name of channel and appropriate background image
AND will be presented with a horizontal scrolling list of content that can include:
Playlists and Series tiles

example:
![](index.php?/attachments/get/5282)

title: Verify playlists on Channel page
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is on a Channel page
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects a playlist tile (noted by title with (#of items in playlist) at right)

example:
![](index.php?/attachments/get/5282)
custom_expected: THEN the user will be full screen playback of the 1st video in the playlist

title: Verify Series on Channel page
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is on a Channel page
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects a playlist tile (noted by title with (#of items in playlist) at right)

example:
![](index.php?/attachments/get/5282)
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be full screen playback of the 1st video in the playlist
AND if allowed to complete playback to end of video; then the next video in the playlist will auto-play
(AND so on until all episodes of the series are played)

Note: At end of Series playlist playback - another playlist will autoplay.
The revolving playlist feature is something that will eventually be updated/changed: at the moment the PS is constructing the list dynamically, but Mobile and ATV are working with the Services folks to have the playlist done on the server side. 
GoPro is aware of this effort and I don't think there's currently any requirement that the channels follow a particular order, so I think as long as the videos just keep playing we are in good shape.

title: Empty Watchlist

custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a message displays centered in screen:

  Currently there are no items in your Watchlist. Please add you favorite videos and shows and you will see them here.

AND the legend will be hidden.

AND 1 or more videos have been saved to the watchlist
custom_expected:
THEN "SHOWS" list all display 1st
AND series will be ordered alphabetically
AND to the right of the last Show in the list a separate section for VIDEOS will display
AND the videos will display most recently added first followed by subsequent additions
AND legend displays at bottom of screen when a list items is in focus:
(☐) Remove from Watchlist
(△) Search
(✕) Select
(O) Back



![](index.php?/attachments/get/4536)
![](index.php?/attachments/get/4538)

title: Verify removing items from watchlist (while in watchlist)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the watchlist page
AND has at least 1 item added to their watchlist
custom_steps:
WHEN the user brings an item the wish to remove from their watchlist into focus
AND presses (☐) REMOVE FROM WATCHLIST button
custom_expected:
THEN the '✓ Removed' scrim overlay displays on the tile
AND the legend toggles button to (☐) ADD TO WATCHLIST

Note: Tile will remain displayed in Watchlist until page is exited, once user exits Watchlist and returns the tile will no longer display.
![](index.php?/attachments/get/4545)

title: Verify removing items from watchlist (while NOT in watchlist)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is not on the watchlist
AND has at lest 1 item added to the watchlist
custom_steps:
WHEN the user brings an item the wish to remove from their watchlist into focus
AND presses (☐) REMOVE FROM WATCHLIST button
custom_expected:
THEN the '✓ Removed' scrim overlay displays on the tile
AND the legend toggles button to (☐) ADD TO WATCHLIST
AND if user navigates to their watchlist, that item will no longer be displayed

![](index.php?/attachments/get/4544)

title: Verify video playback of watchlist
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the watchlist
AND has at least 1 item added to the watchlist
custom_steps:
WHEN the user brings an item in their watchlist into focus
AND presses (x) SELECT button
custom_expected:
THEN the video will load (display loading animation)
AND begin full screen playback

title: Verify video playback of watchlist (playlist)
custom_preconds:
IF the user is on the watchlist
AND has at least 2 added to the watchlist

note: test should be performed on watchlists of varying sizes to confirm consistent behavior
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has selected a watchlist item, that IS NOT the last item in their watchlist to playback full screen
AND allows that video to play to completion
custom_expected:
THEN the video will end
AND the next video in the watchlist will launch to full screen playback without issue
AND if Up Next view is opened; the currently playing video and Up next video will be correctly displayed in the playlist (along with the other items)

title: Search: User is able to toggle search windows by pressing triangle.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps: On the discover screen, press the triangle button
custom_expected:
The screen is dimmed and a search window appears on screen.

Also test on other screens (Channels, watchlist, account).
As of now the user can press triangle and access the search box on every screen besides the search screen itself.

title: Search: User is able to access search by selecting the magnifying glass icon.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
On the directional pad, press up to select the header
Select the magnifying glass icon in the header
custom_expected: The search screen is opened and user can enter search terms here.

title: Results: Appearance
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
Select the magnifying glass icon to select search
Select the search field
Type in a search term "show" (this should bring up enough results)
custom_expected:
- User can see SHOWS, VOD, and Live Events that match their query
- SHOWS will appear first to the left side of the screen
- VOD/Live Events will appear to the right of SHOWS in the VIDEOS section
- Live Events will appear ahead of VOD within the VIDEOS section
- A user will be able to add videos to their watchlist from search
  
  
- User should be able to see results for their query from matching Shows, VOD, and Live Events
- User should be able to navigate to that content by clicking on it

title: Results: LIVE Event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
AND there is currently a live event
custom_steps:
Select the magnifying glass icon to select search
Select the search field
Type in the title of the live event in the search box
custom_expected:
- Live Events will appear ahead of VOD within the Videos section
- Selecting a Live Event tile takes the user to the Live Event Player
- Top Nav will always be in view

title: Results: SHOWS
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
Select the magnifying glass icon to select search
Select the search field
Type in a search term "show" (this should bring up enough results)

View the leftmost results - SHOWS

Select some of the results
custom_expected:
- Selecting a Show takes the user to the Show Page
- Top Nav will always be in view

title: Results: VOD
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
Select the magnifying glass icon to select search
Select the search field
Type in a search term "show" (this should bring up enough results)

View the rightmost results - VIDEOS

Select a result
custom_expected:
- Selecting a VOD tile takes the user to the VOD Player
- Top Nav will always be in view

title: Results: No results found.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
Select the magnifying glass icon to select search
Select the search field
Type in a bogus search term "qwerty1" (this should bring up no results)
custom_expected:
- The search finds no results
- "No results for qwerty1."
- Make sure user can't press down and interact with the results (should only be able to select search bar again or press up to select header buttons)

title: Results: Cancel selection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
Select the magnifying glass icon to select search
Select the search field
Type in a search term "show" (this should bring up enough results)  
  

- User should be able to see results for their query from matching SHOWS, VOD, and Live Events
- User should be able to navigate to that content by clicking on it
- Selecting a SHOW takes the user to the Show Page
- Selecting a VOD tile takes the user to the VOD Player
- Selecting a Live Event tile takes the user to the Live Event Player  
  
- Try selecting a SHOW then press the back button to cancel
- Try selecting a VOD then press the back button to cancel
- If there is a LIVE event, Try selecting a LIVE show then press the back button to cancel
custom_expected: - Every time you cancel your selection, you should be taken back to the results screen.

title: Results: Playing VOD - Up Next
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
Select the magnifying glass icon to select search
Select the search field
Type in a search term "show" (this should bring up enough results)

View the rightmost results - VIDEOS

Select a result
custom_expected:
- Selecting a VOD tile takes the user to the VOD Player
- Up Next is populated by other videos from Search Results

title: Media Controls: Media Drawer
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps: User is on the VOD Player and Up on the d-pad to bring up Media Drawer.
custom_expected:
- Media Drawer rises
- Timeline appears
- Button Hints appear

title: Media Controls: Button Hints
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps: User is on the VOD Player and Up on the d-pad to bring up Media Drawer.
custom_expected:
Button Hints - the button hints include:

[L1, R1] 10s SKIP
[Down] MORE
[X] PLAY
[O] CLOSE  
  

- *Note* Currently the user can seek incrementally using R2 and L2. There are currently no button hints as per Dave Ambrose "no L2/R2 buttons were spec'ed as required."

title: Media Controls: Play / Pause
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
Select a VOD.
Press the X button.
- playback should pause

Press X button one more time
- playback should resume
custom_expected: Ensure playback can pause and resume.

title: Media Controls: 10s skip
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
Select a VOD.
Press the R2 button a few times (observing the current progress time)  
  
Do this again but pressing the L2 button (reverse direction)
custom_expected:
The progress should jump in increments of ~10 seconds.
R2 moves forward and L2 moves backward.

title: Media Controls: Incremental seek
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
Select a VOD.
Press R2 once and observe seek speed
Press R2 a second time and observe seek speed
Press R2 a third time and observe seek speed
Press R2 a fourth time and observe seek speed
Press R2 a fifth time and observe seek speed
custom_expected:
Each time R2 is pressed, the FFWD speed (up to 4 speeds). The fifth time R2 is pressed, there is no change in speed.
  
Repeat the steps with L2 and verify the same goes in the reverse direction.  
  
- *note: As per Dave Ambrose "no L2/R2 buttons were spec'ed as required." so there are no button hints for these buttons.

title: Media Controls: Cancel incremental seek
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
Select a VOD.
Press R2 to start seeking
Press [O] to close media controls
custom_expected:
Seek should cancel and the video should resume playback from where the user initially stated the seek command.  
  
Press seek again and make sure seek starts only from the current playback position.

title: Media Controls: More Drawer
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps: User is on the VOD Player and presses down on the D-pad.
custom_expected:
- The More Drawer tab will rise up
- AND focus is set to Up Next -> the next video tile in the list

title: Up Next: Playlist
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
User is on the VOD Player and presses down on the D-pad.
The MORE Drawer tab will rise up
AND focus is set to the next video tile in the list
custom_expected:
- The users highlight state will land directly on the next video in the playlist
- The users highlight state will have a light blue border around video
- The users highlight state will have a play icon with white PLAY icon and 25% opactity grey fill behind
- The CURRENT video will be shown to the left of the next video, with a scrim over the thumbnail saying 'now playing'
- The CURRENT video will be highlighted an opaque grey
- The video thumbnails on the Up Next tab should be the same as the tiles on Channel/Show pages
- Video tiles will have title, creator name, and runtime displayed

title: Up Next: Button Hints
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
User is on the VOD Player and presses down on the D-pad.
The MORE Drawer tab will rise up
AND focus is set to the next video tile in the list
custom_expected:
Button Hints - the button hints include:

- [□] ADD TO WATCHLIST or REMOVE FROM WATCHLIST
- [X] PLAY
- [O] CLOSE

title: Up Next: Cancel
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
User is on the VOD Player and presses down on the D-pad.
The MORE Drawer tab will rise up
AND focus is set to the next video tile in the list
Press [O] button
custom_expected: - UP NEXT is closed, video playback is not interrupted.

title: Details: Metadata
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
User is on the VOD Player and presses down on the D-pad.
The MORE Drawer tab will rise up
AND focus is set to the next video tile in the list
AND user presses Down on the D-pad to highlight UP NEXT
AND user presses Right on the D-pad to highlight DETAILS
custom_expected:
Details should consist of the following metdata on the left column:

- Video Title (1 line, truncated with ellipsis if it goes over)
- description (4 lines max, truncated with ellipsis if it goes over)
- Runtime
- Channel icon (if there is currently a channel for specific video)
- Channel name
- Creator name
- Go to channel button (if there is currently a channel for specific video)

title: Details: Tags
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
User is on the VOD Player and presses down on the D-pad.
The MORE Drawer tab will rise up
AND focus is set to the next video tile in the list
AND user presses Down on the D-pad to highlight UP NEXT
AND user presses Right on the D-pad to highlight DETAILS
custom_expected:
Details will have tags in the right column that the user can focus on and navigate through

- tags are divided by Athletes, Music, and Gear
- Music should be in the following format: Artist_Name "Song_Name"
- will be no more than 4 tags per row
- tags will have a max width, and text will truncate with ellipsis if it exceeds it
- selecting a tag will launch a search with the tag as the query, and the user will be taken to a Search Results page that displays the results of the search against the tag
- there may or may not be tags for all categories (Athletes, Music, Gear) for each video
- when their are no Extra's associated to the video, we remove the Extras button completely. When it is available we show it on the left side.

title: Details: Select tag
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
User is on the VOD Player and presses down on the D-pad.
The MORE Drawer tab will rise up
AND focus is set to the next video tile in the list
AND user presses Down on the D-pad to highlight UP NEXT
AND user presses Right on the D-pad to highlight DETAILS
Select available tags by highlighting them and pressing X.
custom_expected:
- selecting a tag will launch a search with the tag as the query, and the user will be taken to a Search Results page that displays the results of the search against the tag.
- Video playback will stop
- User will be unable to go back to video

title: Details: Go to Channel
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
User is on the VOD Player and presses down on the D-pad.
The MORE Drawer tab will rise up
AND focus is set to the next video tile in the list
AND user presses Down on the D-pad to highlight UP NEXT
AND user presses Right on the D-pad to highlight DETAILS
Select Go to Channel and press X.
custom_expected: User is taken to the specified channel page

title: Details: Cancel
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
custom_steps:
User is on the VOD Player and presses down on the D-pad.
The MORE Drawer tab will rise up
AND focus is set to the next video tile in the list
AND user presses Down on the D-pad to highlight UP NEXT
AND user presses Right on the D-pad to highlight DETAILS
User then presses [O] to cancel
custom_expected: Details Drawer closes, video playback does not stop.

title: Extras: Tab position
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has selected VOD to full screen playback
AND that video asset has associated Extras content
custom_steps: WHEN the user presses down on the D-pad to open the MORE Drawer
custom_expected:
THEN the Extras tab will be displayed first in the list (furthest left position)

![](index.php?/attachments/get/5304)

title: Extras: Tab in focus
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has selected VOD to full screen playback
AND that video asset has associated Extras content
custom_steps:
WHEN the user presses down on the D-pad to open the MORE Drawer
AND brings the Extras tab into focus
custom_expected:
THEN the Extras tab will display blue 
AND the playlist of Extras content displays above the tabs, with keyframe image to indicate content
AND display progress bar (if previously watched)
AND do not display title or metadata 

![](index.php?/attachments/get/5304)

title: Extras: Button Hints
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has selected VOD to full screen playback
AND that video asset has associated Extras content
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects Extras tab from the drawer
AND Extras has been selected
AND Extra playlist is in focus
custom_expected:
THEN the legend displays the following Button Hints - 
- [□] ADD TO WATCHLIST or REMOVE FROM WATCHLIST
- [X] PLAY
- [O] CLOSE

title: Extras: Extra in focus
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has selected VOD to full screen playback
AND that video asset has associated Extras content
AND the More drawer is open with the Extra tab in focus
custom_steps: WHEN the user presses up on the D-pad
custom_expected:
THEN the 1st Extra in the playlist will be in focus
AND the tile will be a slightly scaled up version of the keyframe
AND a blue outline will highlight the perimeter
AND a 25% opacity gray scrim with white play icon overlay displays over the image
AND below the tile the video title displays in a single line
AND below the title the creator (if available) and the length of the clip

![](index.php?/attachments/get/5305)

title: Extras: Extra playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has selected VOD to full screen playback
AND that video asset has associated Extras content
AND the More drawer is open with the Extra tab in focus
custom_steps:
WHEN the user presses up on the D-pad 
AND brings any Extra into focus
AND selects that Extra: via (x) controller button
custom_expected:
THEN the corresponding Extra begins full screen playback
AND navigating to Details tab displays the Extras' details.

title: Extras: Extra play to end of video
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has selected VOD to full screen playback
AND that video asset has associated Extras content
AND the More drawer is open with the Extra tab in focus
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects and Extra to playback
AND allows the video to play all the way to the end
custom_expected:
THEN the the video will stop on the last frame of the video (full screen)
AND the More drawer will rise up to display the Extras playlist; to prompt the user to choose another video 
AND the user is able to select another option from the drawer
OR can close the video player and return to the appropriate channel/series/menu page.

title: Extras: Extra playback > return to Parent video
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user viewing an Extra video in fullscreen playback
custom_steps:
WHEN the user presses down on the D-pad to open the More drawer
AND switches tab focus to Up Next
AND selects the "Now Playing" video tile from Up Next playlist
custom_expected:
THEN the Extra video will stop playback
AND the parent video of that Extra will start fullscreen playback.

title: Network: Verify bandwidth/stream quality adapts with network fluctuations
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
AND we are currently connected using a wireless ad hoc network
AND we begin playing a video
custom_steps:
WHEN we throttle the network connectivity using Terminal Commands for our Ad Hoc Network

EX:
sudo ipfw add 1 pipe 1 src-port 80
sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 3000KByte/s
sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 500KByte/s
sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 75KByte/s
sudo ipfw delete 1
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the bitrate adapt
AND the video playback will adjust accordingly based on the connectivity of the wireless ad hoc network

title: Network: Verify video quality improves with connectivity improvement
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we have access the Channel
AND we are connected to an Ad Hoc network
AND the connectivity has been throttled to a lower byte setting
custom_steps:
WHEN we begin playback
AND we slowly increase the available connectivity speeds
custom_expected: THEN the video quality will improve to a higher bitrate as the connectivity improves

title: Network: Verify when throttling connection strength that bitrate playback adjusts without issue in both directions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed GoPro Next
AND we access the Channel
AND we are currently connected using a wireless ad hoc network
AND we begin playing a video
custom_steps:
WHEN we throttle the network connectivity using Terminal Commands for our Ad Hoc Network to lower the connectivity speeds
AND we throttle the network connectivity to increase the connectivity speeds
custom_expected: THEN we will see the quality of the video adjusts in both directions in correlation with the connectivity speed

title: Discover - verify progress bar on video tiles partially watched
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has selected the Discover tab from menu
custom_steps:
WHEN the user brings a video tile into focus
AND the video begins to autoplay
AND it is allowed to play for at least 10 seconds
AND the user then navigates to a different tile
custom_expected:
THEN the previously playing tile will stop playback
AND display the keyframe
AND a blue progress bar representative of the amount just watched will display below the keyframe image in a horizontal gutter

title: Discover - verify no progress bar displays on video tiles not viewed
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has selected the Discover tab from menu
custom_steps:
WHEN the user brings a video tile into focus
AND the video begins to autoplay
AND it is allowed to play for at least 10 seconds
AND the user then navigates to a different tile
custom_expected:
THEN the previously playing tile will stop playback
AND display the keyframe
AND a blue progress bar representative of the amount just watched will display below the keyframe image in a horizontal gutter

![](index.php?/attachments/get/5285)

title: Series page - verify no progress bar on episode(s) not watched

GIVEN the user is on a Series page

Example: Two Roads
custom_steps:
WHEN the user scrolls through the series playlist
AND has not watched any episodes of the series
custom_expected:
THEN no progress bar will be displayed on any of the tiles
AND there will be a grey horizontal gutter along the bottom of the keyframe (where progress bar will display once a video has been played)

![](index.php?/attachments/get/5284)

title: Series page - verify progress bar on episode(s) watched
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on a Series page

Example: Two Roads
custom_steps:
WHEN the user scrolls through the series playlist
AND selects an episode 
AND the video begins to playback full screen
AND it is allowed to play for at least 10 seconds
AND then the user backs out to previous page before video reaches completion
(or selects a different video)
custom_expected:
THEN a blue progress bar representative of the amount just watched will display below the keyframe image in a horizontal gutter on the video watched

![](index.php?/attachments/get/5286)

AND Up Next view displays
AND the user scrolls through the playlist

THEN each of the video tiles that have been previously watched (partially or in whole) display a blue progress bar representative of the amount watched will display below the keyframe image in a horizontal gutter.

title: Rest Mode & Resume
custom_preconds: (from Sony Platform Requirement PS4: Rest Mode R4017 - Rest Mode & Resume)
custom_steps:
(1) On TestKit, set "Settings" > "★Debug Settings" > "Boot Parameters"
> "Release Check Mode" to "Release Mode".

(2) From "Settings" > "Power Save Settings" > "Set Functions Available in 
Rest Mode", mark the "Keep Application Suspended" checkbox.

(3) From the home screen, select the application and start it.

(4) Within the application, press and hold the PS button. From the quick menu,
select "Enter Rest Mode". Especially perform the check in sections where 
the online mode/network feature is used.
Note that it is also possible to transition once to the home screen and
then to transition to the rest mode. Also test this case if the application
changes behavior when it is running in the background.

(5) Press the PS button and return from the rest mode.
When using RTC/TSC, to detect a bug in the usage, leave the TestKit in
the rest mode for a long time. Choose a time duration that is appropriate
according to application specifications, for example, the time required
to discard a network authentication ticket.
custom_expected:
- A crash or deadlock does not occur when returning from the rest mode and application advancement does not become impossible.
- Advancing to certain modes such as, the online mode and use of features implemented on the application are possible without having to restart the application.
